name: Tam Sua (Papaya Salad With Vermicelli)
description: This tam sua recipe is a refreshing and spicy papaya salad with vermicelli noodles, perfect for an easy and delicious Thai meal.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely slice the culantro leaves, quarter the lime, and chop the tomatoes into quarters or smaller, based on size.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely slice the culantro leaves, quarter the lime, and chop the tomatoes into quarters or smaller, based on size.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the green papaya and thinly shred it into slivers.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel the green papaya and thinly shred it into slivers.

recipeInstructions.text: In a mortar, pound the garlic and chilies until they’re broken down.
recipeInstructions.name: In a mortar, pound the garlic and chilies until they’re broken down.

recipeInstructions.text: Add fish sauce, fermented fish sauce, tamarind paste, palm sugar, and squeeze in the lime juice, tossing the lime peels into the mix. Use the pestle to mash and mix until palm sugar is dissolved.
recipeInstructions.name: Add fish sauce, fermented fish sauce, tamarind paste, palm sugar, and squeeze in the lime juice, tossing the lime peels into the mix. Use the pestle to mash and mix until palm sugar is dissolved.

recipeInstructions.text: Drop in the tomatoes and gently stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Drop in the tomatoes and gently stir.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the shredded papaya to the mortar, mixing thoroughly to ensure every slice is flavor-soaked.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the shredded papaya to the mortar, mixing thoroughly to ensure every slice is flavor-soaked.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully mix in the rice vermicelli, use a rice spoon to help if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix in the culantro and bean sprouts, then serve immediately.
